title: Corner Protest
description: Join us for the Corner Protest every Tuesday and Thursday. Engage in positive actions, stand for democracy, and express that wrongs are universally recognized. Specific event on December 18th at 2601 S College Ave.
meeting_location: SW Corner of Drake and College in Fort Collins
raw_text:
Join the Corner Protest every Tuesday and Thursday 3:15-5:15 PM
SW Corner of Drake and College in Fort Collins
Positive engagement
PROTECT DEMOCRACY
Right or Left … we all know this is WRONG!
WE THE PEOPLE
OMG GOP WTF
Thursday, Dec 18, 2025
3:15 - 5:15 pm
2601 S College Ave, Fort Collins, CO
raw_summary: The image advertises a recurring protest event called 'Corner Protest' happening every Tuesday and Thursday from 3:15-5:15 PM at the SW Corner of Drake and College in Fort Collins. A specific event is noted for Thursday, Dec 18, 2025, at 2601 S College Ave, Fort Collins, CO.

title: Olympia Visibility Brigade: Overpass Bannering
description: We invite people to join us with high-visibility protest signs and flags. This event aims to raise awareness and encourage action against perceived threats to democracy.
raw_text:
OLYMPIA VISIBILITY BRIGADE
OVERPASS BANNERING

20 DECEMBER 2025
FROM 12:00 TO 2:00

EASTSIDE ST SE / I-5
OLYMPIA

BRING YOUR HIGH-VISIBILITY PROTEST SIGNS, FLAGS, & A GOOD MOOD, AND JOIN US ON THE BRIDGE TO MAKE GOOD TROUBLE!

DEMOCRACY IS UNDER ATTACK STAND UP FIGHT BACK!

MORE INFORMATION: OLYMPIA INDIVISIBLE, BACKBONECAMPAIGN.ORG, AND THEBLOP.ORG
raw_summary: The image promotes an event called "Olympia Visibility Brigade: Overpass Bannering" scheduled for December 20, 2025, in Olympia, Washington. Participants are encouraged to bring protest signs and banners.

title: Indivisible NWA Meeting
description: Join us for our next monthly meeting aimed at empowering Arkansans to participate in democracy.
meeting_location: Bentonville Public Library, Walton Foundation Community Room
raw_text:

Empowering Arkansans to do democracy.

raw_summary: The image advertises an upcoming meeting for an organization called Indivisible NWA. The meeting is scheduled for Saturday, December 20th, from 1:00 to 2:30 at the Bentonville Public Library in Arkansas.

title: Stand Up Loveland
description: A peaceful protest in support of constitutional rights, immigrant, transgender communities, and federal workforce. The event encourages participants to bring signs and flags.
raw_text:
Stand Up Loveland

Please stay on sidewalks & use cross walk signals - NO impeding traffic or pedestrians!

Every Saturday
Line the sidewalks from Sprouts to Tesla
Noon - 2 pm

A peaceful protest to stand up together in support of our constitutional rights, our immigrant community, our transgender community & our federal workforce. Bring a friend, signs & flags sharing your voice & heart with our community.

Saturday, 20 December
12:00 pm - 2:00 pm
1606 N Lincoln Ave, Loveland, CO 80538 & along US-34

#TeslaTakedown
#BoycottTesla
raw_summary: The image promotes a peaceful protest event called 'Stand Up Loveland,' advocating for constitutional rights and supporting various communities. It highlights the location, date, and time, along with key points about the purpose and conduct of the protest.

title: Overpass Bannering: Dark Mode
description: Join us for an overpass bannering event to spread a message of love. Bring warm clothing and a good mood to help make good trouble.
raw_text:
OLYMPIA VISIBILITY BRIGADE
OVERPASS BANNERING: DARK MODE

22 DECEMBER 2025
FROM 4:30 TO 6:30
CHEHALIS WESTERN TRAIL / I-5
LACEY

BRING WARM CLOTHING AND
A GOOD MOOD, AND JOIN US ON THE BRIDGE TO MAKE GOOD TROUBLE!

FIGHT HATE WITH LOVE

MORE INFORMATION:
OLYMPIA INDIVISIBLE, BACKBONECAMPAIGN.ORG, AND THEBLOP.ORG
raw_summary: The flyer promotes an event organized by the Olympia Visibility Brigade for an overpass bannering activity named "Dark Mode." It is scheduled for December 22, 2025, from 4:30 to 6:30 at the Chehalis Western Trail / I-5 in Lacey. Participants are encouraged to bring warm clothing and a good mood to help spread a message of love. More information is available from Olympia Indivisible, Backbone Campaign, and theblop.org.
